clinical_study.brief_title: ER/LA Opioid Surveillance for Emergency Department Visits and Hospitalizations for Overdose and Poisoning
clinical_study.official_title: Extended Release (ER) / Long-acting (LA) Opioid Analgesics Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS) Assessment 5.1: Surveillance of Emergency Department Visits and Hospitalizations for Opioid Overdose and Poisoning Events

brief_summary.textblock: Study to evaluate the impact of the ER/LA opioid REMS program on the incidence of Emergency Department visits and hospitalizations for overdose/poisoning and death among patients prescribed ER/LA opioid analgesics.

detailed_description.textblock: As part of the FDA-approved plan to evaluate the effects of the REMS program, the REMS Program Companies (RPC) are required to submit FDA assessment reports on a regular basis. The present study is one of several program evaluation components carried out in support Assessment 5: Surveillance monitoring for misuse, abuse, overdose, addiction, death and intervention taken. This study will evaluate the impact of the ER/LA opioid REMS program on the incidence of ED visits and hospitalizations for overdose/poisoning and death among patients prescribed ER/LA opioid analgesics.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of ED visits for opioid overdose/poisoning and mortality
primary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective review over period from July 2010 through December 2014

primary_outcome.measure: Number of hospitalizations for opioid overdose/poisoning and mortality
primary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective review over period from July 2010 through December 2014

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective review over period from July 2010 through December 2014

study_pop.textblock: Patients that receive at least one dispensing of an ER/LA opioid during at least one study REMS period with at least six months of prior continuous health plan eligibility in the main analyses. Additional analyses will consider patients enrolled in the HIRD or a participating Medicaid plan regardless of ER/LA opioid exposure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. At least one dispensing of an ER/LA opioid after 01 July 2010
2. At least six months of continuous health plan eligibility prior to the first recorded dispensing of an opioid that occurs during an included REMS period
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Missing or implausible values for age
2. Missing or implausible values for gender
